resources.string:
This software will run games for the Nintendo 3DS handheld game console. No game titles are included.

Before you can begin with emulating, please select a folder to store Borked3DS's user data in.

What's this:
Wiki - Borked3DS Android user data and storage

Next, you will need to select a Game Folder. Borked3DS will display all of the 3DS ROMs inside of the selected folder in the app.\n\nCIA ROMs, updates and DLC will need to be installed separately by clicking on the folder icon and selecting Install CIA.
Share Borked3DS\'s log file to debug issues
Install alternative drivers for potentially better performance or accuracy
Custom driver loading isn\'t currently supported for this device.\nCheck this option again in the future to see if support was added!
Allows Borked3DS to populate the games list
Changes the files that Borked3DS uses to load games
Modify the look of the app
Would you like to replace your current GPU driver?
Invalid driver selected, using system default!
Made with \u2764 from the Borked3DS team
Projects that make Borked3DS for Android possible
Learn how to setup Borked3DS and jump into emulation.
Select your Games folder with the button below.
Grant the notification permission with the button below.
Borked3DS won\'t be able to notify you of important information.
Grant the camera permission below to emulate the 3DS camera.
Grant the microphone permission below to emulate the 3DS microphone.
Games won\'t be displayed in the Games list if a folder isn\'t selected.
Select your user data directory with the button below.
This step is required to allow Borked3DS to work. Please select a directory and then you can continue.
Configure your theme preferences for Borked3DS.
Some controllers may not be able to map their D-Pad as an axis. If that is the case, use the D-Pad (Button) section below instead.
Only map these buttons if the D-Pad (Axis) settings above do not work with your controller.
Press or move an input to bind it to %1$s.
Move your joystick up or down.
Move your joystick left or right.
This control must be bound to a gamepad analog stick or D-pad axis!
This control must be bound to a gamepad button!
Use a wizard to automatically map controller buttons.
Download system files to get Mii files, boot the HOME menu, and more
Borked3DS is missing keys to download system files.
Show HOME menu apps in games list
Run System Setup when the HOME Menu is launched
Please do not close the app.
Please make sure you are connected to the internet and try again.
Please restart the download to prevent issues with having incomplete system files.

Due to how slow Android\'s storage access framework is for accessing Borked3DS\'s files, downloading multiple versions of system files can dramatically slow down loading for games, save states, and the games list. Only download the files that you require to avoid any issues with loading speeds.
Uses the Just-in-Time (JIT) compiler for CPU emulation. When enabled, game performance will be significantly improved.
Set the emulated 3DS clock to either reflect that of your device or start at a simulated date and time.
Changes the emulated CPU clock frequency. Underclocking can increase performance but may cause the game to freeze. Overclocking may reduce in game lag but also might cause freezes.
The system model that Borked3DS will try to emulate.
Use the original 3DS OS software for emulation. For example, use the same keyboard screen as a 3DS when games request the software keyboard, rather than a popup.
If Clock is set to Simulated Clock, this changes the fixed date and time to start at.
The system ticks count to use when Borked3DS starts. Simulates the amount of time the system ran before launching the game. This accounts for games that rely on the system tick to seed randomness.
The tick count to use when Initial System Ticks is set to Fixed.
Number of steps per hour reported by the pedometer. Range from 0 to 65,535.

This will replace your current virtual 3DS with a new one. Your current virtual 3DS will not be recoverable. This might have unexpected effects in games. This might fail if you use an outdated config savegame. Continue?
Loads 3GX plugins from the emulated SD card if they are available.
Allow Games to Change Plugin Loader State
Allows homebrew apps to enable the plugin loader even when it is disabled.
Save data to a virtual SD card. Uses the sdmc folder located inside the main Borked3DS user folder.
Select where the image of the emulated camera comes from. It may be an image or a real camera.
If the Camera Image Source setting is set to Device Camera, this sets the physical camera to use.
Select the image flip effect to apply.
The following settings may improve performance or compatability with certain games, but may also cause glitches or crashes on others. Use with caution.
Emits the fragment shader used to emulate PICA using SPIR-V instead of GLSL.
Enables a Vulkan extension that may improve the rendering quality, at the cost of some performance.
Performs various optimizations on SPIR-V modules to improve performance and reduce size. Equivalent to passing -O or -Os to spirv-opt.
SPIR-V output validation checks validation rules described by the SPIR-V specification. Ensures that outputs are valid and protects from bad inputs. Useful for debugging.
Legalizes the SPIR-V code for Vulkan. Primarily used for HLSL shaders.
Improved accuracy but extremely expensive on tilers.

Optimizes shader code by allowing certain floating-point operations to use reduced precision. Can improve performance by reducing memory bandwidth and computational requirements. May cause issues on certain GPUs, particularly on Mali GPUs.
Compiles shaders in the background to reduce stuttering during gameplay. When enabled, expect temporary graphical glitches.
Perform presentation on seperate threads. Improves performance on Vulkan in most games.
Synchronizes the game frame rate to the refresh rate of your device.
Set a custom value of CPU ticks. Higher values can increase performance but if set too high, it may cause the game to freeze. A range of 77 to 21,000 is recommended.
When enabled, core downcount will be limited to a smaller time slice, reducing CPU usage. It may improve performance for low-end devices or GPU hungry games.
Boost low priority starved threads during kernel rescheduling. It may improve performance, at the cost of freezing during cutscenes for some games.
Enables linear filtering, which causes game visuals to appear smoother.
Enhances the visuals of games by applying a filter to textures. The supported filters are Anime4K Ultrafast, Bicubic, ScaleForce, xBRZ Freescale, and MMPX.
Uses hardware to emulate 3DS shaders. When enabled, game performance will be significantly improved.
Skips the slow drawing event from the PICA core. May improve performance, but can cause visual artifacts.
Skips the texture copy event from the rasterizer cache. May improve performance, but can cause visual artifacts.
Skips the CPU write event from rasterizer cache invalidation. May improve performance but can cause graphical bugs.
Overrides upscaling for dst_params. May fix texture ghosting for some games, but may crash other games as well.
Uses more accurate multiplication in hardware shaders, which may fix some graphical bugs. When enabled, performance will be reduced.
Uses a separate thread to emulate the GPU asynchronously. When enabled, performance will be improved.
May reduce thermal throttling by reducing clock speed slightly. Decreases the performance.
Expands the display area to include the cutout (or notch) area.
When enabled, emulation speed will be limited to a specified percentage of normal speed.
Specifies the percentage to limit emulation speed. With the default of 100% emulation will be limited to normal speed. Values higher or lower will increase or decrease the speed limit.

Prevent 3DS camera, screenshot, and custom texture images from being indexed by Android and being automatically displayed in the Android Gallery. Device may need to be rebooted after setting in order to take effect.
The amount of frames to skip. May not work well with Realtime Audio enabled. Experimental.
Overrides the sampling filter used by games. This can be useful in certain cases with poorly behaved games when upscaling.
Specifies the resolution used to render at. Higher resolutions improve visual quality, but may impact performance and cause glitches in certain games.
Turning off this setting will significantly reduce emulation performance! For the best experience, it is recommended that you leave this setting enabled.
Warning: Modifying these settings may slow emulation
Specifies the amount of 3D depth. This should be set to higher than 0% when Stereoscopic 3D Mode is enabled.
Eye to Render in Monoscopic Mode
Change default eye to render when Stereoscopic 3D Mode is set to Off (Monoscopic).
Anaglyph algorithm to apply when Stereoscopic 3D Mode is set to Anaglyph.
Swaps which eye is shown where. Combine with the Side by Side Stereoscopic 3D Mode and cross your eyes to experience 3D with no equipment.
Scales the screen to a percentage of its original size.
Specifies the percentage of empty space to shift the screens horizontally. Positive values move the two eyes closer to the middle, while negative values move them away.
Specifies the percentage of empty space to shift the screens vertically. Positive values move the two eyes towards the bottom, while negative values move them towards the top.
Use the JIT engine instead of the interpreter for software shader emulation. Enable this for better performance.
Reduce stuttering by storing and loading generated shaders to disk. It cannot be used without Hardware Shader Acceleration ebabled.
Increases graphics throughput on supported devices, improving performance. Use of this setting can increase power usage and temperature. May cause stability issues on certain devices.
Textures are dumped to dump/textures/[Title ID]/.
Textures are loaded from load/textures/[Title ID]/.
Loads all custom textures into memory rather than when the game requires them. Not recommended for devices with less than 8GB of RAM. 12GB+ recommended.
Load custom textures asynchronously with background threads to reduce loading stutter.
Stretches audio to reduce stuttering. When enabled, increases audio latency and slightly reduces performance.
Scales audio playback speed to account for drops in emulation framerate. This means that audio will play at full speed even while the game framerate is low. May cause audio desync issues.
Select the audio API to input sound with. Select None to disable the microphone.
Select the audio API to output sound with. Some may perform better than others.
Please follow the guides to redump your game cartidges or installed titles.
All advanced settings will be reset to their default configuration. This can not be undone.
Do you want to reset this setting back to its default value?
This option can\'t be changed while a game is running.
The game properties could not be loaded.
Expand to Cutout, Speed Limit, Hide Images
Open for listening to GDB connections.
The port number to listen for GDB connections on.
Select the level of verbosity to display in the log files. All messages from that level and below will be displayed. Ranges from Critical (i.e. minimal) to Trace (i.e. everything). Default is Info.
Use POSIX-format regular expressions to display only log entries that match the regex. For example, to only display <Info> level messages, enter \\<Info\\>.
Log additional graphics related debug information. When enabled, game performance may be significantly reduced.
Record frame time data. Saved as a separate .csv file in the log folder.

Print Vulkan API calls, parameters, and values to an identified output stream.

May need to be enabled globally through ADB first with:
adb shell "setprop debug.vulkan.layers 'VK_LAYER_LUNARG_api_dump'"

When done, disable it with:
adb shell "setprop debug.vulkan.layers ''"

To set the save location:
adb shell "setprop debug.vulkan.api_dump.log_filename '/sdcard/Android/vk_apidump.txt'"
Press Back to access the menu.
Specifies the position of the small screen relative to the large one in Large Screen layout mode.
Specifies the factor by which the large screen will be over the small screen in Large Screen layout mode.
Specify custom layout screen positions in Landscape Screen Layout mode.
Specify custom layout screen positions in Portrait Screen Layout mode.
How opaque or transparent the second 3DS screen should be in Custom Layout mode. Useful if the second screen is to be positioned on top of the first screen. Experimental; may not work on all GPUs.
Are you sure that you would like to close the current game?
While loading the specified Amiibo file, an error occurred. Please check that the file is correct.
You need to allow write access to external storage for the emulator to work.
The external storage needs to be available in order to use Borked3DS.
No files were found or no game directory has been selected yet.
Warning: Savestates are NOT a replacement for in-game saves, and are not meant to be reliable.\n\nUse at your own risk!
Borked3DS needs to access your camera to emulate the 3DS\'s cameras.\n\nAlternatively, you can also set \"Image Source\" to \"Still Image\" in Camera Settings.
Borked3DS needs to access your microphone to emulate the 3DS\'s microphone.\n\nAlternatively, you can also change \"Audio Input Device\" in Audio Settings.
%s is missing. Please dump your system archives.\nContinuing emulation may result in crashes and bugs.
Installation Failed. CIA file not found.
A fatal error occurred. Check the log for details.\nContinuing emulation may result in crashes and bugs.
Are you sure you want to delete \"%1$s\"?
The installation of \"%s\" was aborted.\n Please see the log for more details
\"%s\" must be decrypted before being used with Borked3DS.\n A real 3DS is required
An unknown error occurred while installing \"%s\".\n Please see the log for more details
Use the operating system\'s color theme across the app (Overrides the "Theme Color" setting when enabled)
Change the color theme of the app\'s menus
When using the dark theme, apply black backgrounds.
Failed to communicate with the Artic Base server. Emulation will stop.
Connect to a real 3DS console that is running an Artic Base server
Delay the game render thread when it submits data to the GPU. Helps with performance issues in the (very few) dynamic-fps games.
Use Artic Controller when connected to Artic Base Server
Use the controls provided by Artic Base Server when connected to it instead of the configured input device.
Flush Log Output on Every Message
Immediately commits the debug log to file. Use this if Borked3DS crashes and the log output is being cut.
Host your own game room or join an existing one to play with people
Invalid address or name is too short!
Room name must be between 3 and 20 characters
